greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Product of divisors of n-th composite number.
reference: Albert H. Beiler, Recreations in the Theory of Numbers, 2nd ed., pages 10, 23. New York: Dover, 1966. ISBN 0-486-21096-0.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The third composite number is 8. The product of all divisors of 8 is 8*4*2*1 = 64.
mathematica: pd[n_] := n^(DivisorSigma[0, n]/2); pd /@ Select[Range[100], CompositeQ] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 07 2019 *)
results.author: _Enoch Haga_
